title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End volunteers collected 180 needles over six days in Southwest Corridor Park after a public safety meeting.
The City of Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly to reduce HIV risk, which is a 22% decrease from 2024.
Councilor Ed Flynn calls for increased resources for needle pick-up and a recovery campus to address city drug issues.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praised Jayson Tatum's rehab progress from an Achilles tear, noting Tatum's advanced recovery timeline.
Tatum is optimistic about returning this NBA season, despite initial recovery expectations suggesting a longer timeline.
Durant, who faced a similar injury, acknowledges modern medicine's advancements since his own Achilles injury recovery.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas posted his first 100-yard game in the Patriots' 24-23 win against the Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Douglas and Terrell Jennings, childhood friends, scored touchdowns amid grieving the passing of someone close to them.
Jennings, promoted from the practice squad, scored his first career NFL touchdown, contributing 35 rushing yards on 11 attempts.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots secured a 24-23 win over the Atlanta Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Patriots QB Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns despite two turnovers contributing to Falcons' points.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasized joy and resilience, encouraging the team to embrace victories despite challenges.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren died unexpectedly at 55 at his home in Newton on Sunday.
Warren made history as the first African American elected mayor in Massachusetts and served from 2009 to 2018.
Before his passing, Warren was the Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard Kennedy School.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas achieved his first career 100-yard game with a 58-yard reception and a touchdown against the Falcons.
Quarterback Drake Maye's performance was marred by two costly turnovers despite big plays and leading the Patriots to a sixth straight win.
Patriots' Marcus Jones struggled defensively as Atlanta capitalized on height mismatches with Drake London in the red zone.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey shows only 33.7% of Boston residents felt 'less safe' in downtown areas, down from 70.6% in 2024.
Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit addressed issues like drug use, crime, and infrastructure, despite reported safety improvements.
Retail vacancies have decreased, suggesting increased safety is encouraging business growth in downtown Boston.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots secured a narrow 24-23 win over the Falcons, extending their win streak to six games.
Drake Maye passed for 259 yards and two touchdowns but had two turnovers resulting in Atlanta's 10 points.
Terrell Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown, contributing to the Patriots' 110 total rushing yards without Rhamondre Stevenson.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants, including Gianni Martinez and his grandmother Rosa Garcia, indicted for statewide sex trafficking in Massachusetts.
Martinez is charged with multiple offenses, including trafficking, rape, and violating restraining orders; allegedly operated from jail.
Five alleged sex buyers indicted, including Andrew Parvey and John Vincent, identified through seized phones and text messages.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'SNL' on Nov. 2 for the second time, with Brandi Carlile as the musical guest.
Teller participated in a mock New York City mayoral debate in the political cold open on 'SNL.'
Brandi Carlile returned for her fourth time as 'SNL' musical guest, following a joint performance with Elton John in Season 50.
